alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 5:19PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN LACKAWANNA COUNTY THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 519 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Clarks Green, or over Waverly, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Scranton, Carbondale, Archbald, Blakely, Dickson City, Olyphant, Clarks Summit, Jessup, Throop, and Jermyn. This includes the following highway exits... Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 190 and 202. Interstate 476 near 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northeastern Pennsylvania.
